title: How to Turn Off Cellular Data for WhatsApp on an iPhone

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the gray cog icon on your home screen that may be in a folder labeled "Utilities." [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Cellular.
steps.content: Tap Cellular . It's next to an icon of a cell tower. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap WhatsApp.
steps.content: Tap WhatsApp . You may need to scroll through the list to find WhatsApp.

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "WhatsApp" to toggle it off .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "WhatsApp" to toggle it off . It will turn white once it's off. Now WhatsApp can't use your cellular data, meaning that you'll only be able to send or receive messages over a Wi-Fi connection. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. This app icon features a white telephone receiver on a green background. This method does not completely turn off cellular data but lowers it instead. You can still use WhatsApp without Wi-Fi, but the quality of pictures in your messages and phone calls will be decreased.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's usually the last item on the menu. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Storage and data.
steps.content: Tap Storage and data . This menu option is next to a broken circle icon near the middle of the menu. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the switch next to "Low Data Usage" to toggle it on .
steps.content: Tap the switch next to "Low Data Usage" to toggle it on . You'll see this toggle under the "Call settings" header. A green switch means the feature is active. You'll be able to use WhatsApp without a Wi-Fi network, but the quality of your calls and the pictures in your chats may not be the quality you like. With this mode activated, you will still spend mobile data when receiving and sending messages and media. To disable this mode, repeat these steps and tap the switch off. It'll be grey or white to indicate that the feature is off.

steps.title: Open WhatsApp.
steps.content: Open WhatsApp. This app icon features a white telephone receiver on a green background. This method will still let WhatsApp use cellular data, but your background downloads (like the pictures sent in your chat messages) will not download until your iPhone is connected to a Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Tap Settings.
steps.content: Tap Settings . It's usually the last item on the menu. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Storage and data.
steps.content: Tap Storage and data . This menu option is next to a broken circle icon near the middle of the menu. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Tap an option and select Wi-Fi.
steps.content: Tap an option and select Wi-Fi . You can also select Never if you want to manually tap each file to download it. Repeat for each option underneath the Media auto-download section. You can always return to these settings to enable them again.

steps.title: Does WhatsApp use data?
steps.content: Does WhatsApp use data? WhatsApp will use your data plan if Wi-Fi is turned off. If you don't want it to, you can disable data for WhatsApp.

steps.title: What happens if I turn off mobile data for WhatsApp on my iPhone?
steps.content: What happens if I turn off mobile data for WhatsApp on my iPhone? When you disable mobile data for WhatsApp, you won't be able to send messages or make calls outside of Wi-Fi. The app may still open, but you'll need Wi-Fi to reload and refresh messages.

steps.title: Can I use WhatsApp without the Internet?
steps.content: Can I use WhatsApp without the Internet? You can only use WhatsApp without Wi-Fi if you have cellular data enabled. Otherwise, the app won't reload or refresh.

steps.title: How do I turn cellular data back on for WhatsApp?
steps.content: How do I turn cellular data back on for WhatsApp? To enable cellular data for WhatsApp, go to Settings > Cellular > WhatsApp > toggle on WhatsApp .

steps.title: Does WhatsApp work without Wi-Fi?
steps.content: Does WhatsApp work without Wi-Fi? You can use WhatsApp without Wi-Fi by enabling cellular/mobile data on your phone or tablet.
